column4: Has anyone an idea why my ubuntu 11.10 installation on an 8GB USB Stick doesn´t boot correctly and instead shows something called like "bitbox" whre i could work with ash and in the line on the left stands <initframfs>? I already reinstalled grub, but it didn´t solve the problem...

i started a live system of Ubuntu 11.10, mounted the partition with the ubuntu installation with 'sudo mount /dev/sdc1 /mnt' and then installed grub with 'sudo grub-install --boot-directory=/mnt/boot /dev/sdc'
Script looks good I would chroot to the install and run a mbr load.
hang on I will give you a pastebin.
you know you are booting the thumb right?
here is the chroot but escott knows this stuff so hang for their comment. http://paste.ubuntu.com/1045640/
if you try this ignore the [/code] after the update grub command I did not notice that when I posted.
has it ever booted on this computer to the ubuntu install, it seemed it had been running.
i tried to start ubuntu several times before and looked what happens when i type in 'help' but i never saw the desktop
ah so it could just be a bad install, or some other block, you were getting errors.
your in good hands here I will do some other work.
